reviews.review_msg: KJ was a good prof. Expectations are pretty clear, and assignment proceedings are fairly straightforward. If you do the homework and some studying for the exams, you'll likely receive an A.

Actually it was hard to understanding what he's saying during the class. Luckily,  the course material was not very hard for me. If you're new to programming, and if you are not used to listen English with accent, then You'd better not choose him. He's very helpful. (+ Textbook sucks, there's better books around, so other books can help)

A very good and nice prof. Need you think more on questions he tells you to do and practice more on coding. Can ask him a lot in office hour (but you must do on your own first then have a discussion with him is better).Must hand in homework before due time and keep quite on class. DO NOT miss the exams and they won't hard if working hard.I got A.
